SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BufferedImageRenderer
The BufferedImageRenderer uses a BufferedImage to display an image onto a Screen.
Clickable
Represents an element that can be clicked.
ClickEventHandler
A functional interface representing a handler for click events.
ClickListener
The ClickListener is responsible for handling player clicks for interacting with a Screen.
Direction
The Direction enum represents the four possible cardinal directions in a Minecraft world.
FrameUI
The FrameUI class is the main plugin class for the FrameUI plugin library.
Intersection
The Intersection record represents an intersection between a player and a screen.
IntersectionHelper
Helper class for calculating intersections between players and screens.
ItemFrame
The ItemFrame represents an item frame in the Minecraft World that displays a MapItem.
ItemFrameMetadataPacket
The ItemFrameMetadataPacket is a WrapperPlayServerEntityMetadata packet specifically for item frames.
ItemFrameSpawnPacket
The ItemFrameSpawnPacket is a WrapperPlayServerSpawnEntity packet specifically for spawning item frames.
LeaveListener
The LeaveListener is responsible for removing players from all the screens they are viewing when they leave.
MapItem
The MapItem represents a custom map item in Minecraft.
PacketScreenSpawner
The PacketScreenSpawner uses packets to spawn, despawn and update the Screen.
Renderer
The Renderer is responsible for updating the content of a Screen.
Screen
The Screen is a 2d plane of multiple ItemFrame instances in the Minecraft World.
Screen.State
The State represents the possible states of a screen.
ScreenLocation
The ScreenLocation stores information about the location and orientation of a Screen in the Minecraft World.
ScreenRegistry
The ScreenRegistry interface is used to manage Screen instances across the entire server.
ScreenRegistryImpl
The ScreenRegistryImpl class implements the ScreenRegistry using a simple ArrayList to store a Screen.
ScreenSpawner
The ScreenSpawner is responsible for spawning and despawning Screen instances.
Scrollable
Represents an element that can be scrolled.
ScrollDirection
The ScrollDirection enum represents the two possible scroll directions, UP and DOWN.
ScrollEventHandler
A functional interface representing a handler for scroll events.
ScrollListener
The ScrollListener is responsible for handling scrolls for interacting with a Screen.
